Maths
Class Convolution

java.lang.Object
  Maths.Convolution

public class Convolution
extends java.lang.Object

Convolution is the code for applying the convolution operator.

Method Summary
static double[][] convolute(double[][] input, double[][] kernel)
          Takes a 2D array of grey-levels and a kernel, applies the convolution over the area of the image specified by width and height and returns a part of the final image.
static double[] getGaussianKernel1D(int radius, double sigma)
          Returns a approximation of a gaussian kernel as stencil for the 1D.
static double[][] getGaussianKernel2D(int radius, double sigma)
          Returns a approximation of a gaussian kernel as stencil for the 2D case.
static double singlePixelConvolution(double[][] input, int x, int y, double[][] k)
          Takes an image (grey-levels) and a kernel and a position, applies the convolution at that position and returns the new pixel value.

Method Detail

convolute

public static double[][] convolute(double[][] input,
                                   double[][] kernel)
Takes a 2D array of grey-levels and a kernel, applies the convolution over the area of the image specified by width and height and returns a part of the final image.

Parameters:
input - the 2D double array representing the image
kernel - the 2D array representing the kernel
Returns:
the 2D array representing the new image

getGaussianKernel1D

public static double[] getGaussianKernel1D(int radius,
                                           double sigma)
Returns a approximation of a gaussian kernel as stencil for the 1D.

Parameters:
radius - Radius in pixels
sigma - sigma for the gaussian to use
Returns:

getGaussianKernel2D

public static double[][] getGaussianKernel2D(int radius,
                                             double sigma)
Returns a approximation of a gaussian kernel as stencil for the 2D case.

Parameters:
radius - Radius in pixels
sigma - sigma for the gaussian to use
Returns:

singlePixelConvolution

public static double singlePixelConvolution(double[][] input,
                                            int x,
                                            int y,
                                            double[][] k)
Takes an image (grey-levels) and a kernel and a position, applies the convolution at that position and returns the new pixel value.

Parameters:
input - The 2D double array representing the image.
x - The x coordinate for the position of the convolution.
y - The y coordinate for the position of the convolution.
k - The 2D array representing the kernel.
Returns:
The new pixel value after the convolution.
